title: Den11
author: Den11
content: Guys who have a simple python trading bot for the exchange https://www.sevenseas.exchange

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: Den11 on September 03, 2023, 12:23:11 PMGuys who have a simple python trading bot for the exchange https://www.sevenseas.exchangeI don't think that anyone is going to share a python based trading bot to you because most of traders of the forum do not rely on bots. I recommend you to learn trading yourself rather than relying on those bots. The bots are brainless and the ones who use those bots for trading purpose will definitely face huge losses. It's much better to learn trading and build your own strategy that may make you profits in long run.

comments.author: Tytanowy Janusz
comments.body: Quote from: SamReomo on September 03, 2023, 02:36:23 PMIt's much better to learn trading and build your own strategy that may make you profits in long run.Its much better to learn trading, build your own strategy, automatize it and run 24/7 on every single trading pair available isn't it?Quote from: SamReomo on September 03, 2023, 02:36:23 PMThe bots are brainlessThats their biggest advantage over people. bots don't get bored, bots don't get tired, bots don't get carried away by emotions. Bots implement the strategy invented by the creator.Quote from: Den11 on September 03, 2023, 12:23:11 PMGuys who have a simple python trading bot for the exchange https://www.sevenseas.exchangethere is no such thing as "simple python trading bot". What is it supposed to do? arbitrage, marketmaking, trading based on indicators? besides, I recommend using proven exchanges and not no-names with zero liquidity and zero trust.

comments.author: Den11
comments.body: Quote from: Tytanowy Janusz on September 04, 2023, 05:43:16 AMQuote from: SamReomo on September 03, 2023, 02:36:23 PMIt's much better to learn trading and build your own strategy that may make you profits in long run.Its much better to learn trading, build your own strategy, automatize it and run 24/7 on every single trading pair available isn't it?Quote from: SamReomo on September 03, 2023, 02:36:23 PMThe bots are brainlessThats their biggest advantage over people. bots don't get bored, bots don't get tired, bots don't get carried away by emotions. Bots implement the strategy invented by the creator.Quote from: Den11 on September 03, 2023, 12:23:11 PMGuys who have a simple python trading bot for the exchange https://www.sevenseas.exchangethere is no such thing as "simple python trading bot". What is it supposed to do? arbitrage, marketmaking, trading based on indicators? besides, I recommend using proven exchanges and not no-names with zero liquidity and zero trust.I once downloaded a bot from github and fixed it a bit. The bot tried  first to buy and sell  with some restrictions on price and percentage. To be honest, the risk is big, but it was worth it (I made $468 from $50 in a month) But writing interactions from scratch and the bot is not smart enough.

comments.author: Tytanowy Janusz
comments.body: Quote from: Den11 on September 04, 2023, 04:33:29 PMI once downloaded a bot from github and fixed it a bit. The bot tried  first to buy and sell  with some restrictions on price and percentage. To be honest, the risk is big, but it was worth it (I made $468 from $50 in a month) But writing interactions from scratch and the bot is not smart enough.the risk depends on the strategy followed by the bot. if he is arbitraging on some liquid currency pair, and you understand exactly line by line what the code is doing, and there are appropriate safeguards in the code (like stopbot if loss is greater than X), then the risk is practically zero. It's different than a high leverage trading bot trying to play fortune-telling by predicting subsequent ticks based on technical analysis indicators and you completle dont know whats going on in code.in my opinion, the best solution is to write a bot yourself from scratch, based on strategies that have already been manually tested and worked. The bot only automates what should work manually without it. Nowadays, there is a lot of helpful information on the Internet on how to get a grip on this topic

comments.author: Hamza2424
comments.body: Quote from: Den11 on September 03, 2023, 12:23:11 PMGuys who have a simple python trading bot for the exchange https://www.sevenseas.exchangeHmm, Firstly I want to inform you buddy there is a huge risk involved in using a party Bot, I don't know why you need a trading bot because most of the people here don't refer to trading with bots, except for particular scenarios, Platform integrated bots are preferred as most of the time I use the platform Bot service for trading. The strategy of using third-party bots seems insecure and inefficient.Still, if you want to give a try you should use the test mode, On Github there can be possible more relatable result for you to test your idea.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Quote from: Den11 on September 04, 2023, 04:33:29 PM once downloaded a bot from github and fixed it a bit. The bot tried  first to buy and sell  with some restrictions on price and percentage. To be honest, the risk is big, but it was worth it (I made $468 from $50 in a month) But writing interactions from scratch and the bot is not smart enough.So basically you've managed to edit and run it on your own? What kind of features are you looking for that you are looking for in a script-based trading bot? I suggest making a new thread on services if you want to commission someone to edit or make a bot for you. There is no way you can find a free one that is designed specifically for your purpose. Even if you do, there will always be some restrictions like limited API calls and so on.

comments.author: Den11
comments.body: Quote from: joniboini on September 08, 2023, 02:23:24 AMQuote from: Den11 on September 04, 2023, 04:33:29 PM once downloaded a bot from github and fixed it a bit. The bot tried  first to buy and sell  with some restrictions on price and percentage. To be honest, the risk is big, but it was worth it (I made $468 from $50 in a month) But writing interactions from scratch and the bot is not smart enough.So basically you've managed to edit and run it on your own? What kind of features are you looking for that you are looking for in a script-based trading bot? I suggest making a new thread on services if you want to commission someone to edit or make a bot for you. There is no way you can find a free one that is designed specifically for your purpose. Even if you do, there will always be some restrictions like limited API calls and so on.I was able to make the changes using GPT chat. The bot traded on the txbit exchange, but it closed. On the txbit exchange, many coins had a large price difference compared to popular exchanges. People upload to Github for free to many but popular exchanges.

comments.author: Lakai01
comments.body: Quote from: Den11 on September 04, 2023, 04:33:29 PMI once downloaded a bot from github and fixed it a bit. The bot tried  first to buy and sell  with some restrictions on price and percentage. To be honest, the risk is big, but it was worth it (I made $468 from $50 in a month) But writing interactions from scratch and the bot is not smart enough.Quote from: Den11 on September 08, 2023, 05:09:00 AMI was able to make the changes using GPT chat. The bot traded on the txbit exchange, but it closed. On the txbit exchange, many coins had a large price difference compared to popular exchanges. People upload to Github for free to many but popular exchanges.I would not recommend this under any circumstances if you cannot read and understand the code that ChatGPT generates for you. I've used ChatGPT for code generation before, and it usually doesn't do what it's supposed to do, especially for complex problems like yours. At best the code won't compile, at worst the code does something completely different than you expect and you lose your money. The same is true for Github projects that are not widely used. There, the danger is even greater, since they could be written with bad intentions and, for example, drain your coins. I would therefore also suggest that you post a request here in the services section to see if someone can program it for you cheaply. The code could then be checked by other forum members.

comments.author: crwth
comments.body: Quote from: Den11 on September 04, 2023, 04:33:29 PMI once downloaded a bot from github and fixed it a bit. The bot tried  first to buy and sell  with some restrictions on price and percentage. To be honest, the risk is big, but it was worth it (I made $468 from $50 in a month) But writing interactions from scratch and the bot is not smart enough.So if you have made a lot of money with that bot, why are you still looking? Let alone having an exchange that has a little bit of volume. I haven't heard of the exchange that you posted though.Where did you see it OP?

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: You must provide sufficient information, what types of trading are available? What strategies does the robot use? Does it require KYC?In addition if you want to use a trading bot it is better to use the bots of known and trusted exchanges, you risk using an unknown bot on an unknown exchange!!!Finally, the robot is not suitable for use by anyone because the robot implements the information you give it, so the user must have sufficient experience to program the robot with the necessary commands.

comments.author: michellee
comments.body: Quote from: Den11 on September 08, 2023, 05:09:00 AMI was able to make the changes using GPT chat. The bot traded on the txbit exchange, but it closed. On the txbit exchange, many coins had a large price difference compared to popular exchanges. People upload to Github for free to many but popular exchanges.If you have previously made a bot and benefited from the bot, you can try to make it again. It will be more worth it than you looking for bots from other places that may not guarantee to work properly.From your story, you can make your own bot, which works well. With these skills, you should be able to make bots for other markets so that later, these bots can work even better. Creating the bot may take time, but if it's worth it, why not try again?Apart from that, you can be creative with the skills you have so that you can make even better bots. But it will be even better to trade manually and not rely on bots because it can help you improve your analytical skills.

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: Quote from: Den11 on September 03, 2023, 12:23:11 PMGuys who have a simple python trading bot for the exchange https://www.sevenseas.exchangeI haven't gone through the other comments to see if you already got answer to your question, but the fact here is that, even if anyone got the exact trading bot you are asking for, they still won't give it for free if that is what you are thinking..So what I did suggest is, if this is what you want, then request for it in the service board and state how much you are willing to spend for it, we have a lot of programmers on this forum who I believe will do a great job for you if you are willing to spend money that is worth the time and effort they will put into building the bot for you ..

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: Quote from: Den11 on September 04, 2023, 04:33:29 PMBut writing interactions from scratch and the bot is not smart enough.Writing code when the options you are looking for are not available, such as executing an order when a specific condition occurs according to your strategy, but in most cases, most of the orders are simple or specific, and you will find that open source bots actually perform the purpose as required. Some advanced strategies may require paid versions or demand. One of the developers developed it for you, but the essence of the problem is how to use the bot to make profits for you, and not in the bot itself.be aware of any smart trading using chatGPT as it is mostly not true.
